newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian Mobistar phone subscriptions firm - Telinfo.
newsitem.headline: Belgian Mobistar phone subscriptions firm - Telinfo.

text.p: Belgian communications company Telinfo said on Friday results at its mobile phone unit Mobistar were outpacing forecasts made ahead of its launch last August.

"Mobistar...in which Telinfo has a 10 percent stake, already had a good 180,000 subscribers at the end of June, which is considerably better than forecast," Telinfo said in a statement on its interim 1997 results.
Mobistar said in April it had 120,000 customers, up from 68,000 at the end of 1996. It said also in April it hoped to gain at least 100,000 more subscribers by the end of 1997.
Mobistar is 57 percent owned by France Telecom. Telinfo and other Belgian companies hold the balance. When it was launched last year it was forecast that it would not breakeven before 2000.

Mobistar is Belgium's second GSM mobile phone operator. The first, Proximus, run by Belgacom Mobile, a 75/25 joint venture between Belgacom and AirTouch Communications, said earlier this year it had more than 400,000 customers.
